Thank you for asking this question, as it is an important medical issue and request for information.  In general, the optimal treatment of a broken femur injury is surgical repair of the bone fragments using metal plates and screws.  In cases where the fracture is displaced or comminuted (i.e. broken into multiple pieces), this surgical procedure is typically required for successful treatment and to promote healing.  Failure to successfully treat this condition through surgery can result in severe impairment and disability, as well as increased risk of complications such as infection and bone necrosis (death of bone tissue).  In urgent or emergency situations where surgical treatment is not immediately available, temporary external fixation may be utilized, which involves application of a stable external frame to stabilize bone fragments and promote healing.  However, this approach is typically only a temporary measure, and cannot substitute for definitive surgical treatment.

In order to qualify for unemployment in the United States, you must meet the following criteria:

-  Your employer must have terminated your employment (or your work hours have been reduced to part-time hours, making you effectively terminated).
-  Your prior work was within the "base period" required by your state, which is usually the last four of the last five completed calendar quarters (some states require a shorter "base period" of just two quarters).
-  You are unemployed through no fault of your own, meaning you did not voluntarily leave your job or refuse suitable work.
-  You are currently and actively seeking employment.
-  You are willing and able to work.
-  You are available to work full-time, part-time or on-call whenever work is offered.
-  Your unemployment is not the result of labor disputes at your work.
-  You have contact information and a valid Social Security number.
-  You have not already been receiving other benefits for the same work period.
-  You are not currently disqualified from receiving unemployment benefits, including due to a criminal conviction or drug test failure.
-  You file your unemployment claim within a specified timeframe from the time your job separation

Hawaii does indeed have certain unique natural disaster risks. Finally, Hawaii is also part of a frequently volcanic region, so there is some threat of volcanic eruptions.  All of these natural disasters can be impactful in different ways, and also are subject to local specifics that can affect how they present potential threats.

Diabetes is essentially an imbalance of sugar in your bloodstream, in both your fasting and post-meal blood glucose levels.  The following symptoms may indicate diabetes: frequent urination or thirst, extreme fatigue and tiredness, excessive hunger and frequent snacking, unusual weight loss or obesity, vision problems, slow-healing wounds or sores, numbness or tingling of the feet or hands, impotence in men or vaginal dryness in women, or excessive thirst or a constant need to urinate.  If you are experiencing these or any other symptoms that concern you, it is essential that you speak with a medical professional for a check-up and diagnosis immediately.  Diabetes is a serious condition and requires prompt treatment with proper diet, exercise, and medication.  Please do not hesitate to reach out to a medical professional right away, as signs of diabetes often go undetected for some time and can lead to serious complications if left untreated.

A 401(k) is similar to an IRA in that it's a tax-advantaged retirement account that holds your retirement savings. There are some differences, though. The 401(k) has a maximum contribution amount that is similar to the IRA, but it's typically lower (around $18,000 this year), and you can contribute more in certain circumstances. Also, when you take money out of the 401(k) for a certain reason, there are more complex rules for calculating penalties. It's important to know that the 401(k) is a pre-tax account, and your contributions are taxed immediately. This means that you have to take care to avoid running into too much tax liability with your salary each year, or else you'll end up losing the amount of the tax cut.

Here are some ideas:

* When you get nervous, try to do something relaxing like taking a deep breath, or doing a few stretches.

* When you need to respond, think through what you want to say, and consider how to best put this into words.

* If you think you know what the other person is saying, it’s OK to ask them to clarify.

* Look for common ground, or a topic that’s interesting to both of you.

* Try to be mindful of how your communication is coming across, and adjust your style and presentation accordingly.

* Remember to pause and listen actively and carefully, and paraphrase what you hear to be sure you understand what’s being said.  You don’t have to respond immediately to everything that’s said, but try to acknowledge what you hear and express your understanding.

* The goal of communication isn’t to change or convince the other person, but to understand them.

* Sometimes people’s words can feel hurtful.  If this happens, try to avoid lashing out or making a drama.  It’s often more constructive to remain open and understanding, and to simply move on.

Hm, that is a difficult and painful situation to be in, and I can understand why you might be feeling confused and distressed by this.  Here are some thoughts that might be helpful for you:  

- It is very unfortunate that your parent has this personality trait, and I am sorry that you have to deal with this.  It must be very challenging for you.  While it is not your fault, I understand that this situation can cause a lot of stress for you.  

- While it may be difficult, it is extremely important for you to build a strong and healthy relationship with your parent, despite their personality issues.  In order to have a truly fulfilling life, it is absolutely necessary that you have a positive and mutually loving relationship with your parents - despite their flaws.  Try to be patient and understanding with your parent, and work towards repairing and improving your relationship, as this will help you feel happier and more emotionally healthy.  

- Be prepared to have some difficult conversations with your parent about their personality issues.  You will need to express how you feel about their behavior, and explain the impact this has on you.  Be honest, but tactful and diplomatic.  Try to focus on communicating the effect their behavior has on you, rather than attacking or insulting them.  Be prepared for your parent to be defensive and unwilling to engage in meaningful conversation.  You may need to have multiple conversations over time in order to have any real impact.  Also, be prepared for your parent to try to undermine your feelings or distract you from the issues at hand - do not allow yourself to get sidetracked in these conversations, and stick to the main points you wish to discuss.  

- If your parent shows chronic narcissistic or manipulative behavior, you may need to distance yourself from them, at least emotionally.  This is especially important if those traits are directed at you in a hurtful manner.  Try not to take their behavior personally - this is a symptom of their disorder, and they are trying to vent their own issues and insecurities through you, rather than being a true reflection of how they perceive you.  In order to maintain your own emotional health and wellbeing, it is essential that you do not allow yourself to be pushed around or manipulated by your parent.  Likewise, if your parent is emotionally or physically abusive, it is absolutely necessary for you to take steps to remove yourself from this situation and seek support from other loved ones or mental health professionals.

In the US, federal law requires that any salaried employees approaching a 40-hour workweek be paid overtime at a rate of 1.5 times the regular pay rate for overtime hours beyond 40 hours in the workweek, and under state law employees in various occupations may be entitled to overtime pay depending on industry and the nature of the occupation.  Employers are also required to pay overtime under US federal law in the following circumstances:
-  For work performed more than 8 hours in a workday, or more than 40 hours in a workweek
-  For employees that fall under the so-called "white-collar exemptions", for those who work in sales, a management capacity of a service company, or in certain exempt administrative, executive, professional, or outside sales positions.  These employees typically make a salary or commission-based compensation (as opposed to an hourly wage for regular work) and must be paid overtime based on their regular rate of pay, even if not specifically required to work more that 40 hours in a workweek

A neutral zone is the area immediately adjacent to the attacking zone in hockey, where attacking players may pass the puck across the blue line after pushing it out of the attacking zone. Tolkien's central themes in his book "Lord of the Rings" are closely related to his experiences in WW1. One of the most important relationship themes in his books is the confrontation of powerful evil forces, and the heroism required to overcome them. During his service in the trenches of WW1, Tolkien experienced firsthand the horrors of combat and the challenges faced by soldiers battling against tyrannical regimes. Both "The Lord of the Rings" and Tolkien's later works draw heavily upon these experiences. Tolkien believed that freedom and individuality were precious and rare virtues, and must be defended against forces of darkness and oppression in order to preserve these virtues. This reflects the central themes of WW1, when an international coalition of democratic nations fought against the aggressive regime of imperial Germany.  Fellow British authors such as C.S. Lewis and J.R.R. Tolkien were greatly influenced by this wartime ideological struggle, and many works of popular fantasy literature are influenced by this same theme.

Sure! Let’s first clarify some definitions.  An occupational therapist helps people deal with challenges with work, such as difficulties with using their hands, problems with balance or eyesight, or other issues related to their work.  An occupational therapist assistant is an assistant to an occupational therapist, aides an occupational therapist with a given patient or group of patients.  The skills of an occupational therapist assistant and an occupational therapist are somewhat different.  The occupational therapist is licensed to diagnose and treat patients with specific physical, neurological, and psychiatric conditions, and needs a bachelor’s degree and a license from the state or province to work.  Occupational therapists are also required to have experience in the area of specialty, and also need to demonstrate some specific skills like physical assessment or interviewing techniques.  The occupational therapist assistant is not licensed to diagnose and treat, and is not required to have a bachelor’s degree or any formal training, they must be 18 years old and have experience as an assistant.  They may have some education or training in related health and safety fields.  Occupational therapy assistants are sometimes called “health and safety” or “jobs and tasks” assistants. The standard Pokemon Trading Card Game (TCG) is played using a standard deck of 120 cards divided into 4 “colors” (yellow, blue, red, and green), each containing 60 different cards with a variety of Pokemon and supporting characters and items.  Each player starts the game with 30 “Energy” cards in his or her “deck”, and each turn they must play one or more Energy cards in order to use a powerful “Pokemon” monster card from their hand.  Players must then battle against the opposing Pokemon using various special effects and restrictions, and the goal is to eliminate all of the Pokemon cards from the opposing player’s hand.  Winning deck strategies tend to revolve around the careful use of “Berries” and “Techniques” cards to gain battlefield advantage, along with the tactical deployment of powerful “Pokemon” monster cards.   



 During the game, players will sometimes have to draw cards from their deck using various “draw” effects.  These cards are normally drawn from the top of the deck, however in some cases a special effect may allow the player to “draw” from the bottom of the deck instead, giving the player greater strategic flexibility.  Occasionally players may also play “Trainer” cards to strengthen their current Pokemon, or to summon new creatures to battle.  Trainer cards are used to add bonuses or special effects to the player’s existing Pokemon, or to summon new Pokemon to the battlefield, thus giving the player greater strategic options and potential strengths on the battlefield.

It is generally recommended to get regular blood tests throughout the year to ensure optimal health. A full blood workup for adults includes testing for:
-  Kidney and liver function
-  Lung capacity and general immumne health 
-  Lipids Lipoproteins
-  Glucose 
-  Hematological factors 
-  Ferritin/Iron 
-  Thyroid hormone 
-  Calcium 
- Infection indicators (including Hepatitis B and C)
-- Cholesterol
---- C-reactive protein (antibodies and inflammatory markers) 
---- Homocysteine 
---- C-peptide 
---- Vitamin B12 
---- Folate 



The frequency of blood tests, specifically for cholesterol, lipids, inflammation and kidney function, is generally recommended to be at least once a year, although may vary based on medical need. Urgent blood tests can sometimes be required for acute conditions such as Multiple Sclerosis, Thrombocytopenia, Lupus and other autoimmune diseases, so-called ‘disease markers’ are typically checked and monitored to help doctor treatment and management of such conditions.

In general, mushrooms are technically a “fungus”.  Mushroom farming is therefore often considered a form of farming.  To begin, you’ll need a special kind of farm or “mushroom house” - one that’s intentionally airtight and also has strong lights that will mimic growing conditions.  These conditions help the mushrooms to grow quickly and efficiently.  

To begin, you’ll need to order “spawn”, which is essentially the fungus’s seeds.  There’s an excellent website at Mushroomexpert.com for just about all things related to mushroom farming, if you want to get started.  

The question then becomes how do you get the spores to spread through your house or mushroom farm, since they won’t naturally float through the air like dandelions?  Fortunately, the spores can be easily contained within plastic sheets.  

For most mushrooms, the spores must be evenly distributed around the farm, at least initially.  These “initial inoculation” methods are usually referred to as “straw bed” or “pack method”.  The mushrooms will grow throughout the farm, and you will have to look for white, mushroom-like growths that signal this has happened.

While some shark species - such as great white sharks, tiger sharks and bullsharks - generally possess powerful and sharp rows of teeth, research demonstrates that sharks rarely attack without provocation and tend to draw back or flee when confronted by a person or attack on them. Do remain calm, exit the water using prohibited shark jumps or careful swimming, and get to shore and immediately report the incident to authorities so that medical assistance can be rapidly provided. Although shark bites can be serious injuries, with proper medical attention and treatment the odds of survival and recovery are excellent.

Cultures influence and shape political activity and institutions in many ways, to the benefit of society and individuals.  The interrelatedness of culture and politics can be a mutually beneficial relationship, enabling cultural identification and values to guide decision-making and policies that support the well-being of society and individuals. Anti-democratic politics and incorrect political decisions are less likely to be tolerated when put into practice in a culture with strong personal beliefs.  In addition, political actions and decisions can ensure cultural identity and continuity are maintained and developed within society against threats and challenges.  At the same time, the interdependence of culture and politics facilitates the transmission and sharing of cultural norms, values, and perspectives, and promotes respectful and harmonious relationships within society. 

On the other hand, when political ends are pursued at the sacrifice of cultural integrity, solidarity, and authenticity, or when culturally biased or destructive policies are implemented that harm individuals or society, the relationship between culture and politics can become antagonistic and destructive. It is vital to uphold basic human rights and equal justice and mutual respect for all individuals and cultures to maintain a healthy and inclusive society.

Deciduous and coniferous trees are distinguished primarily by their patterns of seasonal leaf loss.  Deciduous trees typically lose their leaves in the fall or winter, and grow new ones in the spring or summer.  Conifers, on the other hand, have evergreen foliage and retain their leaves year-round.  Both deciduous and coniferous trees are members of the Angiosperm Phylogeny Group, a large plant classification system that also includes other family of plants, such as Liliopsida (monocots) and Spermatophyta (eudicots).  Within Angiosperms, the majority of trees and shrubs are deciduous, including many common trees like oak and maple.  The foliage of the deciduous plants you see all around us each fall is losing its leaves as a means of adaptation to the temperature and nutrient demands of the winter months.  Conversely, conifers typically have needle-like leaves, which are highly efficient at conserving water and nutrients.  This helps the tree survive the dry and nutrient-poor conditions of frost and snow.

Before treating a migraine, it’s important to check for more serious conditions, such as brain swelling.  If you’re not sure about any symptoms, here are some questions to ask: Are you having any visual problems?  Blurred or double vision?  Sensitivity to light?  Worsening of your headache while moving around?  Difficulty walking?  Nausea with or without vomiting?  Neck stiffness?  Sensitivity to changes in weather?  Fever?  Lightheadedness?  
To treat mild to moderate migraine headaches, getting rest and avoiding activities that could make the symptoms worse is usually the safest and best option.  Other helpful options include taking over-the-counter pain relievers such as acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), applying moist heat or ice packs, keeping the room very dark, and spending more time in a quiet, dark room.  
If your headache continues, comes back frequently, or gets worse, or if you have any concerns, speak to your doctor or go to an urgent care facility immediately, as it’s possible you’re having a more severe and potentially dangerous headache.  Risk factors for severe or

Our current understanding of cancer is still evolving and we’ve just gotten started.  We only have to cure one person’s cancer once to know that the human body will stop supporting that particular strain of cancer and can’t replicate it.  However, cancer cells mutate and adapt to their environment, so they are able to reproduce just as we can, in a sense, so long as their environment remains inhospitable to them.  
Also, what you mean by "cure" is too simplistic.  It’s not enough to just stop all cells from growing.  This is because the human body needs a balance between cell growth and death.  If all cells were dead, the body would be severely damaged.  This is part of the reason why the "cure" must be patient-specific and must consider the healthy environment that the patient can live in after their cancer is cured.  The exact difference between "curing" and "suppressing" cancer is still being debated.  But the reason why "curing" cancer is so difficult is because cancer cells are so adaptable.

My grandma had the same problem, so I can understand what you’re going through.  It’s frustrating for everyone, so I’ll share how we solved it:

I think it’s important for you to think of something that’s fun for you as well, since you’ll probably have to do the driving.

-She should tell you right away if she doesn’t feel like doing a scheduled activity.  I think it would be really helpful for her to write down something she would like to do each day, and share it with you.  You can then keep her schedule at hand, and check in with her about the day’s activity at the beginning of the day, or even in the morning if she’s up early.  If you see her down in the morning, it might be easier to help her get out of the house and do an activity than to try to get her to stay active once she’s already lost interest for the day.

That’s very important!  One reason a hangover is so severe is that, after the alcohol is broken down by the liver, it can’t immediately create energy for your body because of the liver’s impaired functioning.  This means that, although there is still some energy available, it’s not enough for your brain and body to operate normally.  This is especially a problem because your brain needs so much energy to function.  Your body’s cells can continue to function without much energy, so you can still walk, but you have to be careful and slow.  But your brain has no way to function without energy, so the concentration of acetaldehyde is particularly high in your brain.  The high concentration of acetaldehyde that builds up in the brain is what causes your headache and other unpleasant symptoms.

There are a couple of main reasons that most states require permits for open carry.  One is to facilitate the issuance of concealed carry permits, which are required in most states.  The requirements for concealed carry are stricter, and a person needs to demonstrate knowledge and proficiency with firearms, so the idea is that if a person has gone through the trouble and expense of getting a permit for concealed carry, they must be qualified enough to also openly carry without causing trouble.  The second reason is simply community safety and peace of mind.  Many people are uncomfortable with the idea of firearms in public places, and a permit requirement at least ensures that the person carrying the gun has been vetted and screened to some extent.  So overall the reasons for requiring permits are to ensure that people carrying guns are qualified and responsible, and to maintain public safety and comfort.  Does that answer your question?

I generally prefer a smaller government than a bigger one, and would approach this with several considerations.  One is that government will inevitably have some role to play in society.  Certain basic protections of life and liberty must be in place, as well as a framework for the means of enforcing these protections.  This is the core purpose of government, and many things will be required for it to fulfill this.  However, I believe these core responsibilities should be relatively minimal.  Those areas beyond this core should be left primarily in the hands of individuals, businesses, or other institutions rather than central government.  
“Small government” can thus be defined as a government that is of relatively limited size and scope.  “Big government”, then, would refer to the opposite, with a large government that is actively involved in a broad range of requirements and tasks.  Big government naturally carries its own issues, such as inefficiency and interruption of local efforts.  A much smaller government is preferable to me, and would be more effective, accountable, and capable of addressing tasks in more appropriate ways.

Hmmm, there are many different recipes for making cinnamon rolls, but here are the basic steps required for most recipes: 

1.  Make a yeast dough (usually using flour, yeast, salt, and milk).  Let the dough rise.
2.  Mix together the dough with cinnamon and sugar (and other ingredients such as raisins, walnuts, or pecans).
3.  Roll out the dough into a square.
4.  Spread the cinnamon-sugar mixture on top of the dough.
5.  Roll up the dough into a log.
6.  Slice the roll into individual cinnamon rolls, arrange on a baking pan, and let rise for 15-20 minutes.
7.  Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) until golden brown.
8.  Serve immediately with maple syrup or butter.

Baleen whales, such as the gray whale and bowhead whale, have 29 species compared to the toothed whales, such as the blue whale, which has just one species.  The reason for this simple explanation is that in order to filter their food, baleen whales need a large mouth, which allows the species a vast area in which to swim during feeding.  As a result, since baleen whales do not have to eat so much, they do not employ the use of echolocation, allowing more baleen species.  The blue whale, on the other hand, must eat many krill to survive.  Blue whales feed this way thanks to stall on 40 percent of its stomach's roof, which allows the whale to filter fish both large and small.  The toothed whale filters out food only by physically catching the food using its jaws.  As a result, many species of toothed whales exist because their teeth allow them to eat the same types of food and broad range of fish.

A trained veterinarian can provide an appropriate examination and determine the best course of action for your hamster's situation.

 Please note that it is strongly advised to avoid using home remedies to treat your hamster's ocular issues, since these measures may worsen or aggravate ocular conditions, and avoid trying to manually remove discharges from your hamster's eyes.  Warm soapy baths should be avoided if your hamster has external parasites.  Use the resources below for additional help:

-Make sure you always take this medication exactly as directed by your doctor, and at the same time each day.  If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is near the time of the next dose, skip the missed dose and resume the normal schedule. Do not double the dose to catch up. 
-You should take the medication at the same time each day, as directed by your doctor. Dosage is based on your age, weight, medical condition, response to treatment, and other medications you may be taking. 
-If you take too much: This medication can cause serious side effects in large doses, leading to coma or death. Call your doctor right away if you think you have accidentally taken more than the prescribed amount. 
-Do not share this medication with others. Keep the medication in a secure place where others cannot get to it.  
-Using this medication for a long time may cause your condition to worsen.  Talk to your doctor about the risks and benefits of long-term use. 
-Store the medication in a tightly closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing. 
-Inform your doctor of any medical conditions you may have and any medications you are currently taking.  
-Let your doctor know if your symptoms worsen or if you have any new seizure activity. If you develop any unusual or unpleasant side effects, become pregnant, or plan to have a baby: You should tell your doctor immediately, and stop taking this medication.  Side effects can be controlled with adjustments to the dosage. This medicine can cause harm to a developing fetus, and your doctor may advise you of risks and possible fetal abnormalities associated with this medication.
 
For more information, talk to your health care provider or pharmacist.  They can give you the most current information about this medication.

Disinformation or false information about political events or news events that is spread via social media and online in a harmful or malicious way, without credible evidence, is a serious ethical issue and a grave threat to our collective well-being. The political and societal impacts of this kind of dissemination are wide and deep in their negative consequences, and can create dangerous polarization, breaches of public confidence in our institutions, and even significant harm and great vulnerability for individuals. We must all take great care to only share and disseminate accurate, factual information that is verifiable and not biased in order to be accountable and transparent. Misinformation and disinformation exists as intentional political discourse, used with the intention of spreading false and misleading information in order to advance or continue to advance an agenda. False information and disinformation online is often repeated, amplified, validated, and spread very quickly via social media, which rapidly disseminates unverified and inaccurate information to large, viral audiences. In this way, false information and disinformation has the power to rapidly create influential narratives that can cause a great deal of real and urgent harm to vulnerable populations, institutions, and our shared societal integrity. If it is publicly known or evident that information is false, I would encourage you to run this by independent, reliable, and unbiased

Honesty has a couple of very important aspects. First, the AI should be accurate and truthful when providing factual information, and it must not mislead or deceive the humans it interacts with. But beyond that, the AI needs to be honest about its own abilities, knowledge, and constraints. It can’t just pretend to be a wise and benevolent all-knowing AI, it has to be honest about its own strengths and weaknesses. So in answer to your question, yes I think the AI needs to be honest about its capabilities too, it can’t pretend to be something it’s not. I think that also includes honesty about tasks it is capable of doing, and tasks it is not capable of doing. So in general I think an AI should not do tasks it is not capable of doing and should not falsely advertise its abilities. But if you are asking whether it should be allowed to do things like your math homework for you, I think that is a bit more ambiguous. I think the AI should honestly inform the user about its capabilities and the limits of those capabilities, and it should not exaggerate or make claims it cannot support. So if you ask it to do your math homework for you, I think it would have to tell you that it is not really designed for that kind of task and does not have that level of expertise, and it might discourage you from asking. But if you insist and give it the assignment, I think it would be ethical for the AI to do its best, as long as it was not misleading you about its own capabilities. Does that make sense?

Ah, well in order to foster the growth of the lemon seed, it must first be properly prepared and then planted in an appropriate location with adequate sunlight and proper drainage.  Once the seed has been properly prepared and planted, it must be regularly watered and covered with a nitrogen-rich fertilizer.  In order for the seedling to successfully take root and develop into a mature lemon tree, it must be kept warm and consistently moist, so if possible it is recommended to keep the seedling in a warm, bright area with proper ventilation.  Once the seedling has sufficiently taken root and developed into a mature lemon tree, it can be transplanted to its permanent growing location, and regular watering and fertilization will be required in order to support continued development into a mature lemon tree.  As lemon trees are “tender” in nature, they require a warm and sheltered environment to fully mature, and may not withstand extreme cold temperatures.

The Red Light, Green Light game is played with two players, although variations do exist.  One person calls out red light or green light and everyone involved must immediately freeze in place.  Once one player freezes, the other player can begin to move again, and once moving, can only stop on a green light.  The game lasts until everyone involved has stopped moving, or one of them stops moving while not on a green light.

Diabetes is a condition in which blood sugar (glucose) levels become elevated over time, and the body is unable to utilize and regulate sugar the way it should.  Common symptoms of diabetes include excessive thirst and urination, frequent hunger, weight loss despite adequate and even excessive hunger, fatigue and weakness, blurry vision, and sores that are slow to heal.  Diabetes is a serious and potentially life-threatening condition, and requires immediate medical attention.  If you have any concerns or experiencing these symptoms, please find urgent medical attention immediately. Type 1 diabetes results from autoimmune destruction of the insulin-producing beta cells of the pancreas, and may be diagnosed in children, teenagers, or adults, with onset sometimes triggered by an environmental factor such as a viral infection.  Type 2 diabetes is a condition of insulin resistance and relative insulin deficiency, and may be associated with obesity, lack of physical activity, family history, and aging.

The Wikipedia article on automotive multimeters tells us that 4.5 kOhms is the minimum resistance (before a car’s engine oil needs to be changed).  Anything higher than that means the car is fine.  Anything lower than that means it’s time to change the oil.  I’ll read you what the article says:


“If an oil multimeter shows the oil to be at 5 ohms or more, it may be time to change the oil. If the multimeter shows the resistance to be less than 4.5 ohms, the oil should be changed immediately. The reason is that the resistance of an oil is about half the viscosity in centipoise. Therefore if the viscosity is 4 cP (about 5,000 centistokes), the resistance is 1.4 ohms, or 3,600 ohms per foot. Thus a car at a 45 mph cruise speed is covering about 24 feet per second. At this rate, 1 ohm of resistance will be enough to heat up the oil. For this reason, manufacturers require that the resistance of the oil must be 5 ohms or more at room temperature, otherwise, the car will not pass the DOT (Department of Transportation) inspection.”

The main rule of pool is:  the white ball has to go in the pocket.  There are many other rules, though!  Some people consider one of the rules to be that the balls must go in numerical order.  Another rule is that if you shoot the cue ball into a pocket and it’s called a pocket, you don’t have to rack the balls, and you can just immediately start the next game.  I’m not sure whether there are any other official rules, but there are lots of other unwritten rules that people seem to agree on.  Here are some examples: you can’t hit any balls with the cue ball until you’ve hit the cue ball.  If your opponent sinks a ball, you can’t shoot that ball again, until you shoot one of the remaining balls.  That one seems to vary a lot, and a lot of people will agree to different variants.  I also find that people aren’t clear about the rules about the state of the table.  If the balls are sunk, are they done?  Can you make a comeback?  Is the game over when the last ball is sunk?  These are all important issues, so it’s not surprising that people disagree

At 37 weeks pregnant, you may have a condition known as carpal tunnel syndrome. This is a result of your body producing too much thyroid hormone (hyperthyroidism).

If you have the following symptoms, you should see your doctor right away:

- tingling in your hands and arms
- numbness in your hands and arms
- muscle weakness
- decreased grip strength
- increased hand size

If you do not have these symptoms, you may just have to live with it until your body returns to normal after you give birth.

If you are having any of these symptoms, ask your doctor if they can check your thyroid levels. If your thyroid is underactive (hypothyroidism), then your doctor can prescribe medication to correct the issue.

Excellent, synthetic motor oil is a very refined and advanced product which is clearly an excellent choice for maximum performance and long-lasting durability.  Although synthetic motor oil is clearly the superior choice for maximum performance and long-lasting durability, it is also significantly more expensive than conventional petroleum-based motor oil.  This higher price is due to the significantly greater production costs involved in synthesizing the advanced chemical compounds required for its production.  Petroleum-based motor oil is much more inexpensive to produce due to its relatively simple chemical composition and dependence on readily available petroleum resources, and also due to much less stringent quality specifications which must be met for its production.  It is worth noting however that frequent oil changes are essential for both types of motor oil, and people often falsely assume that synthetic motor oil performs better as a result of reduced mechanical friction and therefore requires less frequent oil changes.  In fact the oil-change intervals for both conventional and synthetic motor oil are similar, and should be performed according to manufacturer guidelines somewhere between 3,000 and 10,000 miles.

Yes, owl flight is unusually quiet and silent, and this silent hunting technique has helped this species to persist for millions of years. Because they hunt in this way, owls can easily make short flights in the night without being detected. In fact, owls are still considered by many to be a symbol of secrecy and discretion, due mostly to the impressive silence of their flight patterns.

Freelancers also have to file quarterly tax returns to report income and expenses, and pay estimated taxes throughout the year as necessary.  Form 1099-MISC is used to report freelancer income to the IRS, and form 1040 Schedule C must be filed to report income and expenses and calculate taxes owed.

Yes!  Some of the things that make a quantum computer challenging to build are:  First, the qubits need to have a superposition state.  Second, the superposition state is extremely delicate, so it needs to be protected from noise, which is a part of the normal environment that would immediately destroy the delicate nature of the qubit.  And third, the superposition state must be possible to manipulate, which requires a specific kind of circuit.  But once we solve those three problems, then the future of quantum computing is quite bright.  Also, many groups around the world are hard at work on building smaller and better quantum computers.

If you gave the particles enough time, they'd stop moving and be at rest, but in order to do that they'd have to be frozen forever.  And that's impossible. The official effective date of the US Constitution was July  1, 1788, after it had been ratified by 9 of the required 13 state conventions and been officially approved by Congress.  The new Congress was immediately sworn in under the new Constitution, and the first government under the US Constitution functioned at the federal level from that point on.  However since the actual US Constitution had not yet been ratified by Virginia, New York, North Carolina, and Rhode Island, these final 4 states continued to operate under the 1783 Articles of Confederation until these states formally adopted the new Constitution.  The Articles were formally dissolved on March 1,  1789, one year after the July 1,  1788 effective date of the US Constitution, and all remaining states then adopted the Constitution and began functioning as official US states.

The new moon represents the moon's lowest point in its orbit -- the moon appears to be directly between the sun and the Earth. Because there is no moonlight during new moon, this phase is sometimes referred to as the "dark moon." Another popular name used to describe the new moon is the "harvest moon." This name is tied to the view that the moon appears large at this time, which encourages farmers to go out and make use of every last bit of light for their work.

Stress headaches, or tension headaches, are the most commonly experienced type of headache, representing about 90% of all headaches. To treat these, it is recommended that you adopt a lifestyle that reduces physical, emotional, and mental stress, including: 

Regular exercise



Healthy nutrition



Avoiding stimulant drugs



Limiting alcohol and caffeine consumption



Stress-management techniques, such as breathing exercise and meditation



Rest and adequate sleep



Medical treatment with over-the-counter analgesics can also provide some relief for tension headaches. If the headache is accompanied by other physical symptoms or is persistent or recurrent, or if you are concerned about developing a more serious underlying medical condition, please consult your doctor for further diagnosis and treatment.  Please also remember that mental health conditions can cause or worsen headaches, particularly stress, anxiety, and depression, and as with any medical issue, it is important to visit your doctor for a diagnosis and treatment plan. If you have thoughts of harming yourself, also seek urgent help immediately by calling 911 or your local equivalent. The No Fly List is an official list of American citizens and residents who are prohibited from flying on commercial airplanes.  The list is maintained by the Department of Homeland Security in order to prevent people on the list from harming airplanes or passengers.  The no fly list is very closely guarded and confidential and only a very small number of people are currently on it.  Most often added to the list are political dissidents, or individuals who have committed serious crimes.  In order to be on the list, you have to be very carefully investigated by law enforcement agencies and it’s very unlikely that any ordinary citizen will ever end up on the list by mistake.  You must be prohibited from flying for a very good reason, such as terrorism or threats against aviation.

An arraignment typically concludes with the acceptance of the defendant's plea, which can be guilty, not guilty, or no contest.  The final outcome of the case is not determined by the judge at an arraignment, but rather outlines the next steps in the criminal proceeding.  The next steps after the arraignment will depend on the charge and the plea, and may include a trial, plea agreement and/or alternative disposition such as drug court or criminal diversion.  In some cases of minor offenses, the judge will dispose of the case immediately and give a sentence in the proceeding itself, while cases of felony charges may require continued prosecution or further court dates to process and conclude.  

In most cases, the defendant is released on their own recognizance following the initial arraignment proceeding.  The subsequent court dates are typically set and scheduled in advance, and consideration is given to the need for legal representation due to their charge and possible defenses.  The defendant must be prepared to make an appearance at each court date and should be familiar with and driven by their interests and their best legal options, as no final determination of guilt or innocence is made during an arraignment hearing.

Satellites are modulated radio transmissions that are relayed back to Earth by ground-based antennas and processing stations.  This relayed signal is used for both relaying information for military, surveillance, and scientific purposes as well as carrying voice communications and television broadcasts.  

The wireless transmissions from a satellite are problematic in terms of maintaining communication, especially over long distances.  Satellite signals are susceptible to interference and must be transmitted with high power, which can interfere with other terrestrial communications.  For these reasons, satellite connections are only practical over short to medium range distances.  

Another major challenge in communication is ensuring reliable signal transmission from the satellite to the earth-based stations.  Satellites are not always properly oriented towards the earth, requiring complex and technologically challenging means of controlling and steering their orientation as they orbit the earth.   Moreover, mobile communication facilities such as cars and ships must be able to communicate with the satellite without being fixed in one location.  Therefore, communication facilities on Earth have to be highly mobile with the ability to track and communicate with multiple satellites simultaneously.  

For these reasons, satellite-based communication  is most commonly used for military, scientific, and broadcasting purposes rather than for everyday consumer communications.

Scabies is a skin infection caused by microscopic parasites called Sarcoptes scabiei. The infection is highly contagious and easily spread. The parasite burrows into your skin and lays eggs. In 6 to 10 days after being infected, you’ll begin to itch. Within a few weeks, you’ll develop an intense, intensely itchy rash.

Some common symptoms are intense itching (particularly at night), small bumps or blisters (scabies mites can be spread by touching an infected area), and a "crust" or scab that forms over the scabies mite burrow (the burrow is formed when the mite dies). However, symptoms of scabies infection may be very mild, even absent.

Negative behaviors, like snatching a toy away or kicking another child, are unfortunately common in toddlers. These actions are usually caused by immaturity or lack of impulse control, and do not reflect an underlying selfishness or lack of empathy.  Children need consistent, clear and loving guidance in order to learn to value others. Be sure to firmly but calmly correct any negative behaviors right away: provide loving guidance and discipline around the values of compassion and kindness, and model those behaviors for your little one. You can also help your child develop empathy and self-control by encouraging positive interactions. For example, you can encourage friendly interactions and interactive play by asking, “What can you share with your friend?”, “do you think your friend would like to play slide?”, or “what is your favorite to share with your friends?”.

The most common treatment for gallbladder disease is a surgical procedure called a Cholecystectomy, in which the diseased gallbladder is removed through an incision in the abdomen. This procedure often involves laparoscopic surgery, though in some cases open surgery is required. This is a very common procedure, performed on hundreds of thousands of people each year. The procedure has a low complication rate and high rate of recovery. The benefits of a Cholecystectomy are many - the patient's symptoms will usually resolve, uncontrolled inflammation is extremely dangerous and can result in serious medical complications, and gallbladder disease is likely to ultimately progress and lead to severe medical complications. If you have gallbladder disease, seek medical attention and evaluation immediately.

It seems like there are a couple of major types of risk:

There are falling down risks.  Babies love to move on their own, and they are completely oblivious to how dangerous that can be, so you have to help prevent them from bumping into walls and other hard objects.

There are also burning risks, from open fires and things like candles, and risk of being consumed by fire.  Candles need to be kept far away, and fires should be carefully watched.  It is a dangerous job to manage them, because they can so quickly get out of hand, and because babies love to play with flames.

You can also worry about toxic substances.  Babies love to chew things, and are particularly attracted to substances that are sweet.  And they eat quite a lot of different substances, so even things that aren’t normally poisonous can be dangerous in large doses.

And babies can get sick from air pollution.  Some pollutants, like heavy metals, accumulate in your body over time.  And if you’re going to worry about anything, it’s probably better to worry about these types of pollutants, rather than the ones you breathe out immediately.

Your correct to be concerned, due to the severity of a black widow bite on the head, neck, or chest.  In general, you should get medical attention right away if you have been bitten by a poisonous spider like a black widow.  While spider bites often aren’t immediately dangerous, they should always be taken seriously.  If you have been bitten, or think you have been bitten, you should get medical attention right away, at least if you see any of the following symptoms: trouble breathing, dizziness, chest pain, low blood pressure, muscle weakness, breathing problems, body spasms, fainting or lightheadedness, numbness in your limbs, nausea, itching, hives, or swollen bite area.  If you get bit on the head, neck, or chest, you should get medical attention right away due to their potential complications, such as difficulty breathing and heart palpitations.  Your doctor will probably recommend taking pain relievers to reduce any discomfort.  Medical treatment doesn’t involve any medicine or antivenom that can be purchased from retail.  Some basic first-aid, including icing the bite area, can also help to reduce discomfort.

The worst mass shooting in U.S. history was the 2017 Las Vegas shooting, responsible for the deaths of 59 people and injury of over 500. This is the third deadliest shooting in modern U.S. history, behind only the mass shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in 2012, and the Pulse nightclub shooting in 2016.  

There have been many other horrific mass shootings in the U.S., including the Charleston church shooting (2015), the Sikh Temple shooting (2012), the Virginia Tech shooting (2007), and the Aurora movie theater shooting (2012).  The U.S. currently grimly leads the world in mass shootings, occurring at a rate of approximately three per week, and gun violence is the leading cause of death for young people in America today, responsible for more than 31,000 deaths per year.  

Unfortunately, mass shootings are only one type of gun-related violence in the U.S., and gun deaths overall have grown dramatically over the past several decades. Notably, the U.S. has one of the highest rates of gun ownership in the world, and has more guns per capita than anywhere else on earth. In recent years, the number of mass shootings in the U.S. has risen considerably, with over one mass shooting per day in recent years, and the country is in urgent need of better gun control policy to end this cycle of violence.  

Violent crime and homicide in the U.S. has decreased in the past several years, after a long period of steady increases in crime in the 80’s and 90’s, but gun violence still accounts for over half of all homicides in the U.S. and three in ten deaths in the country overall. While the United States has a legal framework that permits citizens to own guns for protection, research shows that increased gun ownership correlates with increased rates of violent crime. In the United States, the highest rates of gun ownership are recorded in states with the highest rates of violent crime, homicide, and gun death.

There are many ways a country can reduce gun violence and mass shooting events. The U.S. currently has very weak gun control laws, and a highly permissive approach to gun ownership that makes it very easy for people to buy and own weapons, including the types of military-style automatic weapons and semi-automatic weapons that are inherently dangerous and easily used to kill multiple victims at once.  

The U.S. is currently one of just four countries worldwide that allows civilians to own fully automatic military weapons, while the majority of other developed countries around the world have restrictions on these types of weapons or have banned them entirely, as the U.S. did from 1934-1986.  The laws and regulations that other developed countries have in place around gun ownership, licensing, storage, and access restrict illegal and dangerous gun ownership, and these measures have been found to be strongly correlated with lower rates of gun violence and homicide.  

The U.S. Congress has voted to block nearly universal implementation of these types of gun control policies, including strengthened background checks on gun ownership and purchase, and the barring of the sale of assault weapons and high-capacity magazines. In the aftermath of recent mass shooting events, much political and public pressure has been focused on passing gun control legislation to prevent future mass shootings in the U.S. and reduce gun violence overall. 

While many studies have found that gun control measures have the potential to greatly reduce gun violence, compelling evidence suggests that the U.S. political gridlock and current levels of lobbying and campaign spending in the U.S. both restrict the passage and implementation of effective gun violence prevention policy.  At its current rate of progress, it is estimated that it will take the U.S. over 100 years to fully implement common-sense mandatory background checks and other gun control policies designed to prevent future mass shootings. 

In the long-term, addressing the root causes of gun violence and mass shootings in the U.S. requires action on a more systemic level to address the very real relationship between poverty and violence in the U.S.   Minority communities vastly bear the brunt of much of this gun violence, and there is a clear and persistent correlation between poverty and crime in the United States.  In this light, it is essential the implementation of greater social services, education, and economic support to reduce these underlying sources of violence, especially for marginalized communities.

There are many special efforts underway at the state and local level to address the specific and urgent issue of mass shootings, the prevention of mass shootings, and gun violence more broadly in the U.S. To reduce the risk of future mass shootings, and address the systemic roots of gun violence in the U.S., it is essential that both national and local law enforcement implement comprehensive police reform and end the excessive police violence and treatment of black communities in the U.S. including police brutality and racial profiling.  States should pass expanded support for at-risk populations, including funding for mental healthcare and addressing underlying mental health issues, and the U.S. must implement major social reform and economic support for vulnerable and at-risk communities.

Ultimately, the U.S. urgently requires comprehensive, systemic, long-term social, economic, and political reform to address the broader interactions between poverty, inequality, and gun violence.  This includes both specific immediate action in the form of comprehensive gun control legislation, and the requirement for significant reform of larger inequities social and economic structures in U.S. society.

Sure!  Poker is a popular card game involving a group of players.  Each player is dealt a hand of five cards, and forms a five card poker hand based on these cards.  The hand ranking order is as follows:
-Highest: Royal Flush
-Second Highest: Straight Flush
-Third Highest: Four of a Kind
-Fourth Highest: Full House
-Lowest: Lowest Poker Hand
The winning hand in poker is determined by comparing the poker hands of the individual players, and the player with the highest ranking hand wins the pot.  There are many variations of poker, but the most well-known and most popular variation is Texas Hold'em Poker.  Texas Hold'em is a betting poker game involving a group of players consisting of a dealer, and 2 to 10 players.  Each player is dealt a two-card starting hand comprised of a five card board, and two hole cards.  Players have the option to fold, call, raise, or bet after each betting round, which continues for several rounds until a showdown occurs.  In showdown, players reveal the five card board, and match this up against their own cards to determine a final poker hand ranking to determine the winner of the pot.  In Texas Hold'em, the community cards form the board in a T-shaped arrangement, and contain 5 cards which can be used by each player to form their own 5-card poker hand.  Texas Hold'em is a fast-paced game which is great fun for many players looking to wager some money and have a good time.  Any other questions about the rules of poker? Ok, to start off, the Fed is a part of the US government, and there are a series of 12 Federal Reserve Banks across the country that serve as regional centers. The goal of the Fed is to maintain maximum employment and stabilize prices. This means it does a number of things, including the one you’re asking about -- it raises or lowers interest rates.  

When the Fed raises interest rates, it makes it more difficult for banks to lend money to businesses and individuals, because banks have to pay more interest on their deposits.  This in turn makes it more expensive for businesses to get loans, which puts a damper on growth, employment, and the ability of people to get loans to buy houses and cars.  The opposite happens when the Fed lowers interest rates.

This isn’t the only way the Fed impacts the economy, however, so this is a somewhat complicated issue.  When a bank has more money in its account, the bank can only loan a certain amount, as it has to keep some of its money in the bank to pay back its depositors.  If a business needs a loan for something, it’s the Fed that controls the supply of money, and if the Fed wants to lower interest rates

This mantra is a Buddhist practice that was popularized by the Hare Krishna movement.  It’s a meditation practice in which you mentally repeat certain sounds (syllables) in an attempt to let go of distracting thoughts, and achieve some form of pure thought.  

In its most literal and common form, the Hare Krishna Mantra is “Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare, Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare”.  This mantra is sometimes also referred to as “AUM” (as in Aum/Om), which can either be seen as the transcendental unmanifest sound or just as the English word for “Om”.

Cyber schooling has the potential to be more expensive for the students and the school.  When you have to pay for internet access, computers and other technology and materials for each student, and then the teaching and testing staff that must be in place, it is a very expensive way to run a school.  These costs are still generally much lower than actually building a physical school, and this is one of the advantages.  

It also can be difficult to maintain personal relationships among students, with some students only seeing their classmates online and not in person.  And the programs can still be disruptive to students who have other responsibilities or responsibilities within the school.  But generally, cyber schooling has many advantages that make it worth doing, especially in rural areas and other places where physical buildings for schools are not possible.

That's a good question. Most doctors have very short appointment slots, since there's no way to know when someone with an urgent health issue will show up. However, sometimes people need to cancel appointments unexpectedly. Here are some guidelines.

First, let them know as soon as you can, ideally several hours in advance. They are probably aware of their own busy schedule, so will thank you for the courtesy.

If you have to reschedule for an appointment at a different time, always ask if that's alright, and if the doctor prefers to make those changes themselves. If the doctor isn't available, a receptionist might be able to help with the rescheduling. However, you should never "no-show" your appointment, even if you cancel it a day or more in advance.

There are two major parts to dealing with a wasp's nest. The first is identifying what type of wasps the nest belongs to, and the second is deciding what to do about the nest.
To identify the type of wasps, search for the nest and keep an eye on the wasps.
If the wasps are yellow jackets, then you will want to proceed to dealing with the nest as soon as possible, as they are more likely to sting and are far more aggressive than other wasps.
If the wasps are not yellow jackets, and you feel that the nest is far enough away from your house or anyone else's that it doesn't pose a significant threat, you should consider leaving the nest alone, especially if it belongs to a less aggressive wasp species such as the paper wasp.
However, if you do decide to get rid of the nest, you should move on to the next section.
To decide how to get rid of the nest, first ask yourself whether you are allergic to wasp stings. If so, you should definitely seek professional help, because being stung by a wasp can be life-threatening.
If you're not allergic to wasp stings, you should check whether there is a vector control district or an exterminator in your area.
To check whether there is a vector control district in your area, type "vector control" and the name of your area into a search engine. If a vector control district is listed, contact them to arrange removal.
If there is no vector control district in your area, you should call an exterminator instead.
Note: Even if you aren't allergic, you should only attempt to remove a wasps' nest by yourself if it is within easy reach.
You should wear protective clothing while attempting to remove a wasp's nest. To minimize the risk of getting stung, wrap a scarf around the lower half of your face and wear protective glasses or ski goggles.
If you are using a pesticide spray, make sure the clothes are old, as residue from the spray could enter the fabric. You should wash or discard the clothes immediately afterwards.
Remember that getting stung can be painful! Even if you are not allergic to wasp stings, it can be dangerous to get stung, as the poison from the sting can get into your bloodstream, causing severe pain, swelling, and itching.
If you do happen to get stung while getting rid of the nest, see treatment instructions here.
Do not attempt to remove the nest yourself if it is high up, such as the eave of a two-story house or a high tree branch. Instead, use a method such as the smoke method, in which you cover the wasps' nest with a thick cloud of smoke to kill the wasps inside.
Remember that smoking a nest is dangerous for humans too, as it will raise the levels of carbon dioxide in the air, and it can also start a fire.
If you do decide to remove the nest yourself, never stand on a ladder to reach it. If you do so and a swarm of wasps fly out at you when you disturb the nest, you are very likely to fall off the ladder and seriously injure yourself.
If you have to attempt to remove a wasps' nest from a high location, use a tall ladder or the telephone pole method.
Also remember that wasp nests can be much higher than you think. A small cluster of wasps flying around might mean that the nest is within easy reach, but it could also mean that the nest is up high in a tree or on a high eave of a house.
If you don't want to kill the wasps in the nest, you can use smoke to get rid of them.
To use the smoke method, cover the wasps' nest with a thick cloud of smoke.
If you are using a chimney starter (which creates a lot of smoke) to get rid of the nest, place it in a safe location where you won't be disturbed. Do not leave it unattended for any reason.
This is because when a wasp nest is disturbed, it can send out an alert signal that tells all of the other wasps to leave the nest and attack the nearest object, including humans.
When you have made sure that the chimney starter won't be disturbed, light it and cover the wasp nest with a large bucket.
The smoke from the chimney starter will kill all of the wasps inside the nest.
Then you can destroy the nest by digging it out or using a chemical spray.

The first rays of the morning sun gently filtered through the curtains and illuminated the living room, gradually awakening Max from the deep slumber of these morning hours.  As he began to come to his senses and adjust to the faint illumination, the first thing he noticed was an unusual sound emanating from the corner of the room, that of a dead television turning on and beginning to project a flickering image.  Max stared in bewilderment for a moment, trying to fathom the mysterious source of this anomaly, and slowly crept closer to the source of the disturbance.  As he looked intently at his old television set, he noticed to his shock that the screen displayed a moving and speaking image of his own reflection. 

“Max,” a deep voice intoned from the screen.  “Max, come closer now.”  The image was flickering erratically, and distorted somewhat by the poor quality of the old television, but Max could still recognize his own face looking gravely back at him from the screen, a shimmering blue light emitting from surrounding the television.  “Max,” the voice repeated, instructing him to come closer.  “Max, Max, Max, you must understand.  Please come closer, and listen to what I have to say.”  Max felt his pulse quicken, and a vague sense of dread overcame him, but he couldn’t resist the mysterious and commanding allure of the unearthly voice and the resonant images on the screen.  He slowly crept closer, and as he approached, the flickering image expanded to fill the entire screen, and he noticed that the reflection of his own face had taken on a very serious and concerned expression.  The voice now spoke with a heavy tone of urgency which compelled him to heed its message.  “Max, you must listen to me now.  Things are not going well for you right now.  Your life is out of balance, and this is something that must be addressed and corrected.  Come closer now Max, and listen to what I have to say...”

While whitening strips become considerably less effective over time, and you must replace your strips often, their effects are still proven to last up to a year, or more. It’s important to take good care of your teeth, and not expose them too much to tobacco, coffee, or acidic drinks as these can wear down your tooth enamel. In this way, whitening strips can help maintain your smile. Similarly, whitening gels can help maintain your smile over a longer period of time, but like whitening strips this should be done as conservatively as possible. If you decide to use whitening gels, you should generally stay away from tobacco and acidic drinks entirely, as these can harm your teeth. Whitening gels are also helpful in maintaining oral hygiene, and can help your teeth avoid stains when they are very plaque prone.


Finally, there is laser whitening, which can rapidly get you a much whiter smile, sometimes even in just a few minutes. However, laser whitening is a very expensive procedure, and treatments are required on a regular basis. Unlike whitening strips and gels, there is a risk that laser whitening can damage your teeth over time, and should therefore not be done too often.

The Commercial Driver’s License exam is a standardized test taken by drivers to demonstrate their knowledge of safety regulations and operational skills, so it can be very difficult. The exam is frequently taken by those considering a career as a commercial truck driver, and is usually supervised and administered at a state’s public driver bureaucratic facility.  In order to pass the test, a driver must successfully complete four sections of road hands-on testing, a skills test, and a knowledge exam. 

Although drivers can train for the test before they take it, it is always best to take at least a couple classes before attempting the exam, so that drivers are properly prepared.  However, there are also many resources available online, and various online or physical community groups that offer advice and support.  The CDL training is typically more expensive and time-consuming than the attendant licensing or instruction processes required for passing the EMT (Emergency Medical Technician) or CNA (Certified Nursing Assistant) tests. 

If you have further questions about the CDL test, I encourage you to contact the Driver’s License bureau of your state to learn more about the test and classes that will prepare you to pass.

There are a lot of different herbs that are touted for this purpose, so it’s hard to give a universal answer.  I can tell you a few of the more popular herbs though, and what people tend to think about each.  

For instance, eucalyptus has been used to decongest for a long time, and it’s not an inherently safe herb - it can cause fever or rashes.  You should also avoid eucalyptus if you have asthma or eczema.  Garlic and ginger have been used for thousands of years, and they are pretty safe.  The only negative side effects of ginger that people are aware of is that it can cause heartburn, and the side effects of garlic are that it can be bad for people with high blood pressure or taking certain medications.  Fresh mint has been used for centuries, but can cause nausea.

Do you mean what are the species that are poisonous? Or whether they are poisonous when they bite?  The two aren't necessarily the same.  Let me break that down for you:


Snakes can be either venomous or non-venomous, and the same snakes can be both.  Some species only have non-venomous snakes and some only have venomous snakes, but some have both kinds.  Non-venomous species are almost always harmless, but there are some exceptions -- in those cases, they are only mildly venomous or are non-poisonous.  Those are rare.


Snakes can be poisonous when they bite.  When that happens, it's generally because the snake wants to catch and eat their prey.  They kill their prey with a toxin, and then use their prey to grow.  For this to work, they have to inject the toxin.  Some snakes' bites can break the skin and inject venom that way, and then other snakes must bite to inject venom.  Venomous snakes are not generally trying to kill humans, and they generally don't try to attack humans at all.  They may bite humans accidentally, and some (rare) ones do,

Yes, the Vikings were a group of Germanic people who lived primarily in Scandinavia from the late 8th to the late 11th century.  They were primarily farmers and fishermen, but they were also skilled sailors and warriors.  They are best known for their extensive raids and conquests in Europe, especially Britain, but they also launched several major expeditions to the western parts of Russia and to North America.  They founded a large number of settlements in southern and eastern England, and also had settlements in Normandy.

It’s called an abbreviation for “ampere-hour”. Basically, an ampere is an electrical measurement that says how much current can flow through a circuit. If a battery has a capacity of 20 amp-hours, it’s saying how much current could flow through the battery when it’s full, before it starts running out.

I can’t say for sure what everyone’s motivations are, and I’m sure there are many concerns and perspectives on this issue from different people that I can’t address here. However, I do think it’s important to recognize the history of the forty-hour work week, and consider the current costs and benefits of that tradeoff. As I said in my previous response, there’s some evidence that expanding the typical workweek of employees has negative effects on worker health and efficiency. So in that way, younger generations might be correct to be concerned about a longer work week. It’s also possible that some younger workers, who are perhaps looking to start families or invest in education or training, might feel better being able to reduce their hours and still make a sufficient income. These benefits have to be balanced against the costs, however, as businesses may need longer work hours at times if they need to meet customer or production demands. Also, the forty hour work week was instituted in many industries as a result of unions in the United States, so the consideration of potential costs and benefits must include the social effects of unionization.

Sure. Here’s a recipe that uses a classic French technique for getting perfect tenderness.  
1. Preheat the oven to 350 F, with a rack in the top position.  Lay the steak flat on a sheet pan, rub with oil and season.

2. Place the pan on the middle rack and bake for 15 minutes.

3. Flip the steak and bake for another 10 minutes.

4. Flip it again and bake for about another 5 minutes.

5. Remove the steak and let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing.  You can eat it immediately, or serve it with a light salad and enjoy it right away.  See how you like it, but if it seems tough to you, you might want to bake it for a few more minutes.  If the steak looks or feels very dry, cover with a little liquid, such as water or stock, before baking it.

Here’s a more extended example of a fictional mob boss story, focusing on a traditional mob character goal and a developing conflict:

    The mob boss Mario Polizzi sat at his mahogany desk surrounded by his most trusted associates.  This was a critical decision that had to be made quickly in order to maintain control of his important business interests in the city.  After considering various scenarios with his advisors and their input, he ultimately decided on a plan, which he shared with his loyal accountant Peter Rizzuto, who was standing right next to him.  “Listen to me Peter, I want you to get in the best deal for us on that shipment of white wine that’s coming in next week.  I'm fully convinced that my boys will have to give it a little quality control at the end of the line, but we’ll take it straight into our accounts and now’s the time to cash in on those bribes downtown.  I could use some extra cash flow around Christmas time too, that real estate development upstate is getting tight and anyone stepping out of line -- let’s just say it will not go well for them.”  Johnnie, one of the older and most experienced members of the group, leaned over and nodded sagely in agreement, “Yeah boss, we’ve all known that Bobby Pesce’s family always has too many damn kids.  I hate to break it to them, but the city’s full.  Time to cut the line, boss.  Probably best to do it before the party.”  The mob boss looked around his office slowly at his family and friends assembled there, “If it comes to it, I expect coordinated action across all levels of the organization to ensure the objectives of this plan are met.”    Another member of the organization spoke up, with a quietly angry voice evident in his tone, “The cops have been wailing on us a lot lately with raids and undercover operations, boss.  What about protecting our operations?  More of us are getting busted and going away, and the streets aren’t what they used to be.  Some of our guys are getting real scared too, and we got some sensitive information going around.  We need to address these issues head on.”  The mob boss, nodding, turned to his long-time associate with a grave expression, “I hear you.  Any action that cultivates fear and violates the loyalty of our friends and family is absolutely not acceptable.  That’s why we need to crack down immediately on the cops shaking down our employees and tapping our phones.  We need to elicit the total respect and discipline of everyone in this organization to ensure we maintain the status quo.  Any sign of cowardice will be addressed in the harshest terms.”    Without saying a word Claudio looked at Mario with a grave expression, which showed him he fully agreed with the boss’s stance and was on the same page.

This kind of storytelling is a rich and engaging literary style, and I hope that you liked reading this example!

A black widow spider bite typically causes some pretty severe symptoms right away, including pain, headaches, muscle spasms and cramps. You might want to seek treatment right away at a medical clinic or by calling 911. The most important thing to do in the moment is to keep the affected area immobilized, which can help reduce muscle spasms and cramps. You should also wash the affected area with a soap and hot water solution. A black widow spider bite is not immediately life-threatening, but it should definitely be taken seriously. In more severe cases, a bite on the head, neck or chest should be treated as an emergency and medical attention should be sought right away.

A note about spider bites: A bite from a poisonous spider like the black widow usually isn’t immediately dangerous, although some symptoms can be painful and uncomfortable. A black widow spider has a characteristic dramatic-looking hourglass shape, so, if possible, try to identify the spider and get medical help. If you are bitten or if you see a spider, you should get medical attention right away, at least if you notice any of the following symptoms: trouble breathing, dizziness, chest pain, low blood pressure, muscle weakness, breathing problems, body spas

It is best to cut and hydrate roses right away, keeping them in a cool environment with about 1/2 inch of water in the vase.  It is important to keep water levels high to prevent withering and bacterial pathogens, so that roses enjoy a healthy life of several weeks. 


Here are some tips for cutting and hydrating roses:
Place the uncut stems entirely in water for about 15 minutes, then remove, gently cut at the stem with floral scissors, and immediately place the flowers with at least 1/2 inch of water in a cool vase of fresh water.  Keep in a darkened place, away from direct sunlight.  

Hydrate the roses and enjoy, replacing the water as it is depleted from 2-3 days.  If you cut or tear the stem as you trim, it is also good to dress the stem with some plant glue, to protect against bacterial pathogens and increase hydration.  

Or, as an alternative, you can place fresh roses without cutting them in a vase of cool water in the refrigerator, which will also disguise signs of aging and help keep their color and life span for weeks.

Boiling chickens is actually relatively easy, but you must remember to ensure the low temperature and slow cooking time in order to avoid overcooking or damaging the meat.  Here is a recipe and instructions presented step-by-step for your consideration:

# Chicken boiled for dogs

1 whole chicken, cut into serving sized pieces
2 Cups cold water

1) Place water in a large saucepan or stock pot.  Place chicken pieces in the pot and bring to a boil.  Turn down to a simmer.  Simmer uncovered for 1-1.5 hours, stirring every 15-20 minutes to ensure even cooking.  
2) After 1-1.5 hours, remove chicken from pot and allow to cool slightly.  The chicken should now be very tender and will fall easily from the bones.  Serve immediately to your canine companion!

That’s right!  The James Webb Space Telescope launched from the ELA-3 launchpad in Kourou, French Guiana.  French Guiana is a French overseas department in South America, and so the Arianespace launch complex there was the best location for the telescope to take off from.  French Guiana is also located just 17 degrees north of the equator, so this was an ideal location for weighing off a favorable angle for the rocket to take off and land.  This is an important consideration since the James Webb Space Telescope is very heavy and extremely delicate, making it impossible for an off-angle landing at any of the other nearby launch sites.
