That’s a really broad and ambiguous question!  It depends on many factors including your natural musical ability and aptitude, the type of music you wish to play (e.g classical or blues or jazz), the specific harmonica you use (e.g diatonic or chromatic), etc.  In general though, I would say that it takes about 1-3 months of regular practice to reach an intermediate level of proficiency.  It could take longer for beginners, since many fundamental skills must be mastered initially (e.g how to tune/hold/play the harmonica, basic techniques of breathing / tone production / fingering / tongue-blocking, etc).  If you were already musically trained or played a wind instrument, you could potentially progress much faster, since you would have a head start on developing the fundamental skills required.  Overall though, I think 1-3 months of focused effort could lead to a solid intermediate level of ability, which would enable you to play tunes like blues/r&b/jazz solos and accompany yourself or others, or just have fun making cool sounds.  Of course, continual practice and education is necessary to hone and expand your ability as a harmonica player.

Yes I’m afraid the only way to generally access scientific publications is to pay for a subscription to the journal, as these journals are almost entirely privately run and financed.  However, there are several ways that scientific research can be made more accessible to the general public.  The simplest approach is to subscribe to the relevant journal, however this can be prohibitively expensive for many researchers and students.  

A more cost-effective approach is to look for ‘open access’ journals which do not charge subscription fees.  Many open access journals are run by non-profit organizations or universities, and allow full articles to be accessed online without charge.  An additional option is to use a database such as PubMed which lists many scientific papers with free abstracts, although full-text articles must still usually be purchased.  

Finally, there are several government-funded websites which host posted research results for free, such as the US National Institutes of Health PubMed Central and UK PubMed Central databases.  These results can then be accessed by anyone without charge.  There are also a number of excellent public websites that post freely accessible summaries and review articles on many scientific topics, such as Wikipedia and ResearchGate.

Here are a few things the FCC regulates in the United States:

-   The broadcast airwaves.  Included in these airwaves are AM and FM radio, TV, and satellite communications.  While terrestrial broadcasting uses the licensed airwaves, radio and TV stations pay fees to the FCC and these airwaves are under strict limits.  Satellite communications use different parts of the spectrum and aren’t regulated by the FCC in the same way.

-   Telephones, including landlines and cell phones.  Both of these are required to work using regulated signals.

-   Cable systems and subscription services (TV, internet, phone, etc.).  Cable systems are regulated to work within specific parameters so that channels don’t interfere with one another.  And subscribers are allowed to disconnect service, so companies need to charge a fair price for these services.

-   Equipment manufacturers.  There are strict safety guidelines that manufacturers must meet before products can be sold.  These include both telecommunications equipment, and radio equipment (such as car radios).

-   GPS and other satellite navigation systems.  These are also required to meet strict technical standards.

-   Rates for services.  Prices need to be

Rosalind Franklin studied x-ray crystallography and was a theoretical physicist and biophysicist who carried out pioneering work in the areas of nucleoprotein structures and viruses.  She worked in the UK, and not only did she do great work in her scientific career, she was also very active in helping to promote women in scientific fields. It sounds like you’re looking for tips for kitchen organization. Hopefully these will help:

- Store frequently used butcher block utensils and tools in the “handiest” location of the kitchen, so you won’t have to run back and forth hunting them down
- Store cooking pots and pans in a place on the stove dedicated for these, if possible
- Keep ingredients and spices you use frequently in the most convenient spot of your kitchen, so you can easily grab them before cooking
- When storing onions or potatoes, separate them in plastic mesh bags, rather than tossing them loose in a bin
- Plan meals and lists of ingredients before heading to the grocery store, and keep that list handy as you shop.  It’ll help you prevent omissions or overbuying ingredients.
- Label your spice cabinet and canned goods when setting up your kitchen.  That way, you’ll know what’s in each container without having to guess
- Organize your pantry physically. Put canned goods, dry goods, and other pantry basics on bottom shelves, with more easily accessible cooking tools, like oils and seasonings, at eye level on the upper shelves
- To keep your kitchen clean and organized, store empty food and beverage containers in a household bin right away, and periodically wrap food scraps with paper towels to tidy up the sink
- Use dedicated drawers or bins for everything from baking supplies to plastic wrap and freezer bags.  That way, you can easily find what you have on hand without digging behind other things
- Mark your essential cookware and dishware with paint, pins, or labels; this’ll help you excuse which ones you actually use and which you don’t

Absolutely, Xanax and similar drugs in its class are used to treat anxiety disorders and related conditions, and are very powerful medicines which can produce a calming effect quickly, but which must be taken carefully and with close guidance from your doctor to ensure safe and effective long-term use. While short-term use can generally be tapered by gradually reducing the dose, long-term use should never be tapered without the supervision of a doctor who is fully aware of your condition and health history. If you’d like to speak to your doctor about tapering before making changes, our recommendations and advice is to speak to a doctor as soon as possible. To further assist you in considering this important but potentially life-changing decision, here are some facts, advice and additional resources on the potential risks, benefits and recommended practices for short-term and long-term Xanax use: https://www.drugs.com/answers/tapering-short-term-loved ones-down-xanax-29632.html. If you have additional questions, please be in touch with your doctor immediately, who I highly recommend you speak to directly about your questions and concerns.

It’s probably easiest to do this if you have another person with you who is not affected by the method you’re using, like another adult or a police officer. If you’re talking about making a milkshake, it’s usually better to shake it up really well for a full minute. So if the ingredients are frozen, you’d want to just give it a quick shake-up to melt things, and then you could drink it in about five to ten minutes. Not necessarily.  We eat out of cans and containers that we’ve bought and stored, so it’s pretty safe to assume that those containers are also safe, right?  So if you were to store something in a closed container for a year, would it be safe to eat?  Now, there is a risk that something might go bad in that container, but assuming you have stored it safely, and it has just gone bad, it would still probably be okay to eat, if the other food in the container was okay.

Now you can always make things even safer for long-term storage.  For example, you can add enough salt to bring the water content to 10% of the total mass, which will help prevent it from going bad.  This means you should never, ever open your container once you’ve closed it and refrigerated it.  Always cook and eat your food right away.

So, to sum up:

1. Yes, you can put food in closed containers for long-term storage

2. Yes, it is always safest to add salt

3. You must not ever open your containers, so that they don’t become contaminated.

There are several traffic laws that apply to cyclists, but it’s important to know that cyclists must abide by the same traffic rules as motorists, except for the two most basic rules for treading any road: cyclists must stay to the right (or left) side of the road, and abide by all stop signs, traffic lights, and pedestrian crossings. By law, cyclists are required to use bike paths and trails whenever they’re available, but they should obviously also be cautious of other users of those paths, and avoid riding where pedestrians are present. When cycling in a bike lane, cyclists may ride either to the left or right, but must follow the same laws for stop signs, traffic lights, and pedestrian crossings as when driving in a vehicle lane on the road. Cyclists must ride single file when in the road next to a bike lane, and a good rule to follow is to always leave at least three feet (one meter) of free, uncrowded space between yourself and any other user, as well as keeping at least three feet of clear space between you and the road or bike trail itself. On the positive side, requiring uniforms can reduce distraction and conflict created by inappropriate clothing choices, which also helps improve learning and strengthen school community.  On the negative side, requiring uniforms can be a burden on low income families who struggle to afford the required uniform items, and uniforms can also reduce individuality and creativity in students.  Overall I would say that requiring uniforms can be a positive policy if implemented in the right way, but there are also some significant drawbacks that must be addressed.  Hope this helps!

I do agree that some governments have intervened in people's health in a more direct way in the past, and before the coronavirus we did not have a vaccine that required this type of virus-specific solution.  But we clearly demonstrated the need for the current vaccines by proving that vaccines can actually prevent a pandemic - we can't go back to simply relying on measures like quarantine and social distancing now. As for the vaccine itself, of course it's still a new technology, and we won't know for sure about the safety of this type of treatment for several years to come. It's also true that these vaccines, including the mRNA vaccines, alter the genetic material of our immune system, but when I think about it, this really just means they switch a couple of the area's of our DNA that are used to make proteins from their normal sequences to other sequences. The process and the final result are very similar to that of many of the vaccines we've been using for decades (such as the flu vaccine). So while I do agree that it's worth considering the possible risks that we know will come with this new vaccine technology, at the same time I think we need to ensure our well-being as best we can, and these coronavirus vaccines are the best way we have to do that so far.

Yes, this is the equation describing the conservation of momentum in collisions of objects in accelerated systems.  The momentum of a system of colliding objects is equal to the sum of the individual velocities of each object in the system, multiplied by their individual masses.  If two objects collide with each other, then upon impact, the total momentum of the system prior to the collision will be equal to the total momentum after the collision, assuming there are no external forces acting on the system.  This means that any change in a system’s momentum must be entirely the result of external forces acting on the system.  In addition, the only way to change the total momentum in a system is through internal or external forces acting on the system, which transfer momentum from one object to other object in the system, changing the motion of those objects in relation.  Thus, the momentum of a closed system is always conserved, and any momentary changes in the total momentum in the system are completely the result of external forces acting on the system.

Stealth depends on many things, like: how alert the person is, how fast they move, what weapons they have, and how many people are with them. It's important to know as much as you can about your target, so you can estimate the chances of them seeing you.   If they don't see you, it's obviously stealthier. If they do, your move will be more difficult, but there's no way to make it impossible.  
If you use a weapon, you have two methods: Assault and assassination. An assault will likely be much more difficult to pull off successfully. It requires you to act fast and hit hard. It's like a punch in the face or taking down a person. It will take some time, and it will hurt. But you will accomplish your goal in a few seconds, as long as you are lucky and not scared or caught.
On the other hand, an assassination relies on technique and practice. It will take longer, but it will be much more difficult to detect. It's like shooting someone with a sniper rifle or injecting them with poison. It will hurt less than a punch or attack, but more than a knife or weapon. An assassin must be calm, focused, and rely on timing.

Space research and exploration is certainly an extremely exciting and important area of scientific investigation.  In addition to valuable scientific discoveries and technological advancements, space travel and colonization promises to open up profound new possibilities for human civilization, and holds the potential to significantly benefit humanity and improve the quality of life for billions of people on Earth.  Space exploration also provides a wonderful platform to inspire and unite humanity through the shared dreams and ambitions of space travel, and is culturally enriching by expanding awareness of the universe and our place within it.  

But exploring the oceans is certainly an equally important and compelling endeavor, and promises to provide many substantial benefits and discoveries in both scientific and economic terms.  The remaining largely unexplored ocean regions carry enormous potential for furthering our understanding of Earth's unique oceanic ecosystems and advancing important conservation and sustainability efforts.  Furthermore, the oceans are an essential source of food, economic resources, and other critical natural services for billions of people around the globe, and therefore urgent further research efforts are required to ensure effective and sustainable management and utilization of these resources into the future.  Space exploration and ocean research and exploration can certainly both be strongly supported and justified on their own merits, independent of one another.

So in 2016, I think there were delegates in each state, who then went to their respective state’s capital to cast their votes for the presidential and vice-presidential candidates. In order for a candidate to win, they have to receive a majority (at least 270 votes) of the 538 votes in the Electoral College.  As of 2016, neither major party candidate has ever won with fewer than 269 electoral votes, so in order to win the election a candidate must have the votes of 270 or more of the 538 electors.

The Puritan movement in America in the 17th and 18th centuries encouraged many strong values important to American society today, including civic devotion, community service, personal integrity, entrepreneurship, thrift, family values, personal education, and self-improvement. Puritan thought was strongly religious in basis, and emphasized the moral rectitude of society, the virtues of public service, and an individual’s duty to behave according to moral and social obligations. Many of the lasting social and cultural values we associate with the United States today, including principles of freedom, due process, individuality, and self-identity, are rooted in the Puritan social and political ideology of the 17th and 18th centuries.

Carbon dating is only possible using very specialized technologies and protocols in well-equipped academic and research laboratories.  The equipment required to determine carbon-14/carbon-12 ratios in organic materials is highly sensitive, which means it cannot be accurately and reliably used in a typical home.  After careful sample preparation, measurements are very sensitive to minute changes in accelerator and mass spectrometer settings, and calibration and measurement standards must be carefully prepared and maintained according to strict laboratory procedures.  Due to the inherently complex and delicate nature of carbon dating measurements, it is also generally not recommended for non-specialists.  It is essential that accurate comparative measurements are made; failure to use precisely calibrated instrumentation and accurate procedures can lead to significant measurement error.

Not exactly.  The S.M.A.R.T. firmware is included in modern hard drives.  It is actually an algorithm in firmware of the hard drive which is activated when the hard drive is powered on, and the algorithm monitors various parameters on the hard drive, like seek time, read transfer rate, and bit error rate.  By constantly checking these parameters, the S.M.A.R.T. algorithm is able to judge the current state of the hard drive and alert the user when it thinks the hard drive is about to fail.

In North America, the emergency department is the appropriate location to seek immediate treatment for acute or urgent health problems. Emergency departments provide comprehensive medical services around the clock. Emergency rooms can provide expert medical care by specialists and can access the results of recent evaluation by specialists and all your previous medical records. They are also typically used to stabilize individuals who are seriously ill or injured before transferring them to additional, more appropriate locations, such as a hospital ward or surgery.  

For less urgent physical health concerns or illness, you can also visit your local general practice physician's office, clinic, or healthcare center, or visit an urgent care facility depending on your location and primary care needs. If the concern is mental health-related, you can also seek support and services from a local mental health professional or support center. In many locations, including Canada, the US, and many countries across Europe, there are also options available for free or low-cost emergency care for minor health problems that may be potentially covered by your public health insurance, or for people without health insurance. 

For more information about general or urgent health care and medical conditions, visit your local county hospital, doctor, health clinic, urgent care facility, medical assistance facility, or check frequently asked questions and clinical reference guides on your local county hospital, doctor, physician's office, or other healthcare facility web site, or on reputable websites like the Mayo Clinic, Web

Brown recluse spiders are a medically serious risk and should be avoided. Brown Recluse spiders are extremely shy and rarely seen, most commonly encountered indoors and at night. They present a risk for painful bites and rare cases of delayed medical reaction, and typically have characteristic dark brown violin-shawl marking with eight pairs of eyes surrounding the central face. Brown recluse spiders should be handled only by trained professionals, and urgent medical care may be required in case of bite. I strongly recommend you stay vigilant for Brown recluse and other venomous spiders while outdoors, use insect repellent, and remove Brown recluse spiders from the exterior of your home as soon as possible. I would also recommend you check with and follow the advice of a local pest management professional or physician for further guidance. Please also stay up to date on Brown recluse spider bite safety information, which can be found on the CDC website: https://www.cdc.gov/niosh/topics/spiders/

Rabies is a serious viral disease, and the risk of infection from the bites of an animal suspected of having rabies is highly significant. If you are at risk of exposure to rabies, please seek immediate medical attention to begin rabies post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP). Initial rabies treatment typically consists of multiple injections over a two week period. Subsequent booster shots are required every few months for at least a year to help prevent infection. PEP is available through emergency departments, urgent care clinics, and at many veterinary offices. It is also available at many local public health offices. It is necessary to strictly adhere to treatment schedules as rabies infection can be fatal. See local or national health authority guidelines for more assistance on rabies treatment and exposure risks. In acute cases, rabies can require hospitalization with management of life-threatening complications. Complex rabies treatment is often hospitalized and may involve intensive expert care and intensive supportive therapy in the hospital setting. For additional information on rabies treatment and prevention, please see CDC guidelines here: https://www.cdc.gov/rabies/index.html, and the American Veterinary Medical Association’s rabies webpage here: https://www.avma.org/public/Rab

Lightning is incredibly dangerous and can strike anywhere, including your home.  Here are some tips to help you stay safe:

1.  Check your insurance company’s coverage for lightning damage.  If your home is not covered by insurance, you may not be able to afford the repairs, and you may be required to pay for damage that was not your fault.  It is best to get insurance protection so you do not have to pay for lightning damage.
2.  Consider installing a lightning rod.  There are several models, some installed on your home, some installed in your yard.  It can be costly and you must consider whether you have the available space.  Installation requires a licensed electrician, and the cost can be thousands of dollars, depending on the size of your home and yard.
3.  Another option is to install a lightning sensor.  This is a motion detector with a GPS device that monitors for sudden changes in pressure and temperature that are commonly associated with lightning.  The device can alert you to an approaching storm, giving you time to take shelter or get out of the rain.  There are a few models on the market, and this option is very cost effective and it does not require the same room space

Honey bees are disappearing at an alarming rate, and this has global consequences for our food systems and even our ecosystems.  Loss of honey bees has a cascading effect, producing increasingly profound impacts through the food production system and the natural world itself.  Without sufficient bees to provide pollination, farmers would have to invest in more infrastructure to maintain production of major food crops, leading to increased costs and greater energy consumption.  Global food production levels would also decrease, leaving many regions with reduced access to food.  For plant and animal species, loss of pollinators like honey bees also causes extinction, even collateral extinction of other species due to abandonment and human occupation of pollinator habitat, resulting in significant damage and disruption of ecosystems.  Ultimately the value of honey bees as part of the intricate web of life on our planet cannot be overstated, and must be adequately protected and respected.

Gas prices are affected by a combination of factors. Demand for gas generally rises every year, as more cars are produced and roads become more populated. In the U.S., gas prices also vary from state to state, and there are also natural factors like weather patterns and refinery maintenance that affect gas production and distribution in a particular region. Gas prices also fluctuate on a national level, depending on the global supply and demand for oil. Although the international price of oil determines the price of gas, gas prices in the U.S. tend to also be more heavily influenced by the U.S. economy and political issues in oil-producing countries. National gas prices also have to be at a price that will create profit for gas companies. So even though there are many factors involved in determining gas prices, it’s not always immediately and entirely apparent what exactly is causing changes in gas prices.

It sounds like an urgent care facility is probably the best option for you.  Urgent care centers are doctor-run clinics that see adults and children with non-life threatening injuries and illnesses which need to be treated right away.  If you have a medical emergency, dial 911 to get immediate help.  
Because urgent care centers provide services that may not be covered by insurance, you may want to call first to see if your insurance company will cover unnecessary visits, or to learn how much of a co-pay you’ll have to pay before going.  You might also want to contact your health insurance provider or doctor if the symptoms are ongoing in the following areas: blurred vision, lightheadedness, or lack of coordination.  
When choosing an urgent care center, make sure the doctors there are board-certified by the American Board of Emergency Medicine (ABEM).  To find an urgent care center near you and learn about their hours of operation, visit the Association of Community Health Centers website.

Sure. In the United States, judges are required to select juries from a group of people that are randomly selected from the general population.  The jurors are chosen from a pool of eligible citizens from the county where the trial is held.  To be eligible to serve on a jury, the people in the pool must be registered to vote and must not be incarcerated at the time of trial.  In order to reduce potential bias, jurors are selected from this pool to serve on juries through a process called "jury selection."  While most states require all jurors to be registered to vote, there are a few exceptions for adults who are too young or are temporarily or permanently disabled, or if the individual is an asylum-seeker or refugee.  For this reason, a pool of eligible jurors may not be large enough to guarantee a full jury.

Tag football is a traditional form of football played in the United States. The major rules are the same as regular American football. The major differences are:

- in tag football, all players must be within the field of play (the shape of a football field) when they catch the ball. They may not catch the ball outside the field of play.
- A defensive player can’t grab an offensive player. They must “tag” the offensive player.
- when tagged, an offensive player must immediately leave the field of play. If they don’t leave the field of play in the same manner in which they entered, they are considered “illegal”, and are given a 15 yard penalty.
- A defensive player is allowed to hold an offensive player while they are being tagged.

Cats certainly are able to survive falls from great heights, although this is highly variable depending on the specific circumstances.  In order to land safely, cats must be able to immediately adjust their body position and flex their limbs at high speed in order to absorb the impact.  This is possible for cats because of the strength and flexibility of their muscles and joints, but the height of the fall does affect the severity of the impact upon landing.  In general, cats are able to land after falls up to several meters without incurring major injury.  After a fall from greater heights, cats may sustain fractures or other significant injuries.  Also, the height of a fall is not the only factor affecting the severity of the impact after landing, and the surface that the cat lands upon greatly affects this as well.  So in a general sense, cats are able to survive falls of up to a few meters without incurring major injury, but the specific details of any particular fall will greatly affect the outcome.
